{{Multiple issues|section=| {{Incomplete|date=November 2016}} {{Update|date=November 2016}} }} {{infobox war faction |name = Imam Bukhari Jamaat |native_name = |native_name_lang = |war = the [[Syrian Civil War]] |image = |caption = |active = |ideology = |leaders = Sheikh Salahuddin{{cite news|title=Main Uzbek Militant Faction In Syria Swears Loyalty To Taliban |url=http://www.rferl.org/content/islamic-state-uzbek-militant-faction-syria-taliban/26686992.html|date=12 November 2014|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty}} |groups = |headquarters = |area = |strength = |partof = [[File:Flag_of_the_Al-Nusra_Front.svg|25px]][[File:Flag of Jabhat Fatah al-Sham.svg|border|25px]] [[Al-Nusra Front]]
[[Army of Conquest]]{{cite news|title=Taliban-Aligned Uzbek Suicide Bomber Attacks Shi'ite Village In Syria|url=http://www.rferl.org/content/uzbek-suicide-bomber-syria/27260806.html|date=21 September 2015|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty}}
[[al-Qaeda]] {{small|(until 2016)}} |allies = |opponents = [[Syrian Armed Forces]]
[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant]]
[[Syrian Democratic Forces]]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sNUQ43YTUGU |battles = [[Syrian Civil War]] * [[Siege of Al-Fu'ah-Kafriya (2015)]] * [[Battle of Aleppo (2012–present)|Battle of Aleppo]]{{cite news|title=Over 150 killed in Aleppo fighting|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2015/02/over-150-killed-in-aleppo-fighting.php|date=19 February 2015|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=''Long War Journal''}} * [[Northwestern Syria offensive (April–June 2015)]]{{cite news|title=Jihadists celebrate in key Idlib city after defeating Syrian regime|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2015/04/jihadists-celebrate-in-key-idlib-city-after-defeating-syrian-regime.php|date=27 April 2015|accessdate=15 October 2015|publisher=''Long War Journal''}} }} The '''Imam Bukhari Jamaat''' is an Islamist Salafi group fighting in the [[Syrian Civil War]], composed of primarily [[Uzbek people|Uzbeks]], and expressing loyalty to the Afghanistan's [[Taliban]] movement. The group is allied with other jihadi organisations in Syria such as [[al-Nusra Front]] and [[Ahrar ash-Sham]], and alongside the aforementioned and others it makes up the [[Army of Conquest]], which overran much of [[Idlib Governorate|Idlib province]] in north Syria in 2015. The group is named after [[Muhammad al-Bukhari|Imam Bukhari]], a 9th-century Islamic scholar who was from [[Bukhara]] in modern-day Uzbekistan.{{cite web|url=http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2014/06/uzbek_jihadist_group.php|title=Uzbek jihadist group releases footage from Syrian training camp|work=The Long War Journal|accessdate=16 November 2015}} ==See also== * [[List of armed groups in the Syrian Civil War]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Syrian Civil War}} [[Category:Anti-government factions of the Syrian Civil War]]
